text: LinYee Yuan is a design journalist as well as the editor and founder of MOLD magazine, which examines issues relating to food from a futuristic design perspective. It has readers in Great Britain, France, Germany, Singapore and Taiwan, as well as the United States. == Education == In 2002, Yuan graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Asian American studies from Columbia University. She is currently based in New York. == Career == In 2013, Yuan founded website thisismold.com, which publishes journalism on futuristic food and design. In March 2017, Yuan launched a Kickstarter campaign to fund a physical iteration of the website, which would be published biannually under the name MOLD. With a goal of $34,000, more than $37,000 was ultimately raised. In interviews, Yuan has stated that the goal of both site and magazine is to examine how design and innovation can create food solutions for an expanding global population. == See also == * Bon Appétit (magazine) * Foodie == References == == External links == * Mold on Kickstarter.com Category:American women journalists Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Columbia University alumni
